avalancheActivity.comment:
The fresh wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant and reach medium size. This applies in particular on steep slopes, and adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas.
They are mostly easy to recognise and to be assessed critically.
Avalanches can also be released in the old snowpack and reach medium size in particular on steep shady slopes. This applies in particular in case of a large load.
avalancheActivity.highlights: As a consequence of the moderate to strong northwesterly wind, snow drift accumulations formed.

snowpackStructure.comment:
The high humditiy gave rise on Wednesday to moistening of the snowpack in all aspects below approximately 2000 m. As a consequence of falling temperatures a crust formed on the surface, in particular below approximately 2100 m.
The more recent wind slabs are bonding only slowly with the old snowpack.
Towards its base, the snowpack consists of faceted crystals, especially in shady places that are protected from the wind,.

tendency.highlights: The weather will be mostly sunny. Slight increase in danger of dry and moist avalanches as a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation.

avalancheActivity.comment:
In the last two days clearly visible wind slabs formed in particular in the regions exposed to the foehn wind. The fresh wind slabs can be released easily or naturally above approximately 2400 m. This applies in particular on steep slopes, and in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain.

Avalanches can also be released in the old snowpack and reach medium size in particular on steep shady slopes. These avalanche prone locations are difficult to recognise.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The fresh wind slabs represent the main danger.

snowpackStructure.comment:
As a consequence of falling temperatures a crust formed on the surface during the last few days, in particular below approximately 1900 m.
Towards its base, the snowpack is faceted. This applies in particular on steep east, north and northwest facing slopes,.

tendency.highlights: Outgoing longwave radiation during the night will be quite good. The weather conditions will facilitate a gradual favourable transformation of the snow drift accumulations.

avalancheActivity.comment:
Isolated avalanche prone weak layers exist in the old snowpack. Avalanches can be released in deeper layers, in particular by large additional loads. These can reach medium size.

Apart from the danger of being buried, restraint should be exercised in particular in view of the danger of avalanches sweeping people along and giving rise to falls.
Watch out for the numerous rocks hidden by the little recent snow.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Individual avalanche prone locations are to be found in steep terrain at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions.

snowpackStructure.comment:
The high humditiy gave rise on Wednesday to moistening of the snowpack over a wide area in particular in the Prealps below approximately 2100 m. As a consequence of falling temperatures a crust formed on the surface.

Isolated avalanche prone weak layers exist in the old snowpack.
At low altitude less snow than usual is lying.

avalancheActivity.comment:
In some places new snow is lying on the smooth surface of an old snowpack.
Avalanches can as before be released by large loads, but they will be small in most cases.
The avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular in gullies and bowls above approximately 2200 m and at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack.
Watch out for the numerous rocks hidden by the little recent snow.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Individual avalanche prone locations for dry avalanches are to be found in particular on very steep slopes above approximately 2200 m.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Over a wide area new snow and wind slabs are lying on a hard crust.
As a consequence of falling temperatures a crust formed on the surface, in particular below approximately 2100 m.
At low altitude less snow than usual is lying.
